text: Shay Healy (29 March 1943 – 10 April 2021) was an Irish songwriter, broadcaster and journalist. He was best known for his role as host of Nighthawks, a RTÉ Television chat show. He was also known for composing "What's Another Year", Ireland's winning entry in the 1980 Eurovision Song Contest. In 2004, Healy was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.Sunday Independent, "Presenting with Parkinson's", 18 December 2005 == References== ==Other websites== *Official web site Category:1943 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Irish radio personalities Category:Irish journalists Category:Songwriters
title: Shay Healy
